item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Allen, if a transaction log backup file is deleted, no, there is no way to restore from it. An attempt to restore will result in log chain errors. To correct this, a full backup must be taken and restored from.

item.title: By: Kendra Little
item.dc:creator: Kendra Little
item.content:encoded:
Awesome post, Jes!

My personal habit is to write and run all my restore commands with NORECOVERY and put the DB recovery in a final command by itself, like:

RESTORE DATABASE [DbName]

This is totally a preference thing, of course, I just like having the command where the database is coming online be very explicit.

Restoring to marked transactions can be very cool, too! That would make another great blog post.
